results.title: Adolescent development = Adolescence
results.creator_credit: Leslie Hill and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 17 of Series “Psychology: the study of human behavior”.
Adolescence is the period which occurs anywhere between 10 and 20 years of age, and during which we are trying to work out who we are. At this time we mature physically, sexually, socially, intellectually and morally, but not necessarily at the same rate, which is where some of the conflicts and embarrassments of adolescence occur. The peer group becomes of prime importance as it provides feedback on appropriate behaviour. This program takes a generally positive view of this period as an exciting challenge.

results.title: Adolescence: the prolonged transition
results.creator_credit: George A. Colburn, Darrel Schwandt, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
Through historical and cross-cultural comparisons, the extent to which the concept of adolescence as a period of increased autonomy, identity development, and risk-taking, is a social construction, is examined. The biological aspects of puberty and emerging sexuality are addressed. Observes examples of adolescents in transition from family to a broader adult world.

group_works.title: Joe and Roxy
group_works.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, Don Haldane and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Adolescence: a case study
results.brief_description: A study of adolescence as a time of change. Explores the life of Angie, a 17 year old high school student. Shows her at home, at school and with friends. Dr John Flavell talks about Piaget’s concept of “formal operations” and explains mental development in adolescence.
results.description: A study of adolescence as a time of change. Explores the life of Angie, a 17 year old high school student. Shows her at home, at school and with friends. Dr John Flavell talks about Piaget’s concept of “formal operations” and explains mental development in adolescence.

results.title: Adolescence
results.creator_credit: Philippe d'Argila, M K Productions and Daniel Riche
results.brief_description: A young girl takes ballet lessons with the Princess Troubetzkoy, a very old yet still famous ballerina. One day, she auditions for a ballet company, but another girl gets the job. So the girl goes back to the Princess to continue her studies. A sensitive study of an adolescent ballerina. With Sonia Petrovna and Madame Egorowa.

results.title: Adobe village: valley of Mexico
results.creator_credit: Louis De Rochemont, Joseph Brun and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
Built on a swamp at a high altitude, modern Mexico City was built on the Aztec city of Teotihuacan by the Spanish who invaded the region. This documentary follows a typical Mexican family in an adobe village, weaving serapes, harvesting corn and raising cattles, sheep, horses, goats and donkeys. Discusses their diet, education, work and family life. Also attempts to explain how Aztec Indian culture has ‘blended’ with Spanish culture.

results.title: ADMA for short
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide Pictures, British Petroleum and Ronnie Anscombe
results.brief_description: The building of ADMA enterprise, a special oil drilling platform developed for underwater oil exploration. Exploring for oil on the bed of the Persian Gulf involved the development of this floating platform in a shipyard on Kiel Canal, and the transformation of Das Island, an uninhabited outcrop of rock in the Persian Gulf, into an outpost of industrial civilisation, complete with harbour, airstrip, living quarters and workshops.
